titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Piero Sraffa, 11. 2. 1939
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Abschrift McGuinness, Kopie in BA. Publiziert (WiC, S. 293).

div.p: I’ve been appointed prof.. I hope the future will show that I wasn’t wrong in applying for the post; for, of course, what drove me to it was to a great part (if not alltogether) vanity. However it’s no use crying over spilt milk & I must hope for the best. – One obvious disadvantage which the appointment has for me is that it makes your forecast correct, & you will therefore be more cocksure than ever in our future discussions. However that also serves me right. If I don’t hear from you to the contrary I shall come to you on Tuesday at the usual time.
